messages.message:
Photo by Atef Safadi/EPA-EFEJuly 27 (UPI) -- A rocket attack struck a soccer field in the Israel-controlled Golan Heights, and killed at least 12 children and teens and wounded 29 other people Saturday night.
The rocket attack on the Majdal Shams area occurred several hours after an Israeli airstrike killed three Hezbollah militants in southern Lebanon.
First responders treat a victim after a suspected Hezbollah rocket attack struck a soccer field in the Majdal Shams area of the Golan Heights Saturday evening.
At least 12 were killed and 29 wounded during the rocket attack that struck a soccer field near a playground Saturday evening in the Majdal Shams area of the Golan Heights.
Israel captured the Golan Heights after Syria attacked Israel in 1967 and annexed the area in 1981.

A rocket attack Saturday on a soccer field in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights killed at least 10 people and wounded several others, including children, hours after an Israeli airstrike on south Lebanon killed three members of the militant Hezbollah group.
Hezbollah said it struck a military base in the Golan Heights in retaliation for Israeli attacks on a village in Lebanon.
Hezbollah chief spokesman Mohammed Afif told The Associated Press that the group "categorically denies carrying out an attack on Majdal Shams."
The Israeli military said one projectile was identified crossing from Lebanon toward the area, adding it was cooperating with the MDA to evacuate the wounded.
Israel captured the Golan Heights from Syria during the 1967 Mideast war and later annexed them in 1981.

TEL AVIV, Israel — A rocket attack Saturday on a soccer field in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights killed at least 10 people and wounded several others, including children, hours after an Israeli airstrike on south Lebanon killed three members of the militant Hezbollah group.
Hezbollah said it struck a military base in the Golan Heights in retaliation for Israeli attacks on a village in Lebanon.
The Israeli military said one projectile was identified crossing from Lebanon toward the area, adding it was cooperating with the MDA to evacuate the wounded.
Hezbollah said in a statement that its militants firing Katyusha rockets at an Israeli army post in the Golan Heights was in response to Israeli airstrikes on villages in south Lebanon.
Israel captured the Golan Heights from Syria during the 1967 Mideast war and later annexed them in 1981.

Ten teenagers dead in rocket attack on football pitch in Israeli-occupied Golan as IDF blames Hezbollah militant groupIsraeli security forces and medics transport casualties at a site where a reported strike from Lebanon fell in Majdal Shams village in the Israeli-annexed Golan area.
Picture: GettyBy Christian OliverAt least ten teenagers have been killed in a rocket attack on a football pitch in Israeli-controlled Golan Heights.
The Israeli military said all those killed in the attack were aged between 10 to 20, as the IDF blamed the Lebanon-based Hezbollah militant group for the deaths.
Hezbollah chief spokesman Mohammed Afif told The Associated Press that the group "categorically denies carrying out an attack on Majdal Shams."
The Israeli military said in a statement on Saturday that according to intelligence, the attack was carried out by Hezbollah.

A rocket attack Saturday on a soccer field in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights killed at least 10 people and wounded several others, including children, hours after an Israeli airstrike on south Lebanon killed three members of the militant Hezbollah group.
Hezbollah said it struck a military base in the Golan Heights in retaliation for Israeli attacks on a village in Lebanon.
Hezbollah chief spokesman Mohammed Afif told The Associated Press that the group "categorically denies carrying out an attack on Majdal Shams."
The Israeli military said one projectile was identified crossing from Lebanon toward the area, adding it was cooperating with the MDA to evacuate the wounded.
Israel captured the Golan Heights from Syria during the 1967 Mideast war and later annexed them in 1981.

Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
Israeli police officers and firefighters work at the site of a rocket attack in Majdal Shams, in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights.
Hezbollah chief spokesman Mohammed Afif told The Associated Press that the group "categorically denies carrying out an attack on Majdal Shams."
Destroyed children's bicycles at the site of a rocket attack in the Druze town of Majdal Shams, in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights.
Residents rush to help injured children moments after a rocket attack hit a soccer field.

Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
The strike at the soccer field, just before sunset, followed earlier cross-border violence on Saturday, when Hezbollah said three of its fighters were killed, without specifying where.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since Oct. 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.
AdvertisementMajdal Shams had not been among border communities ordered to evacuate as tensions rose, Israel’s military said, without saying why.
Since early October, Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed more than 450 people, mostly Hezbollah members, but also around 90 civilians and non-combatants.

Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warned that Hezbollah "will pay a heavy price for this attack, one that it has not paid so far."
Israel's military said its analysis showed that the rocket was launched from an area north of the village of Chebaa in southern Lebanon.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since Oct. 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.
Majdal Shams had not been among border communities ordered to evacuate as tensions rose, Israel's military said, without saying why.

Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
The Israeli military's chief spokesman, Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari, called it the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the Hamas attack on Oct. 7 that sparked the war in Gaza.
Israel's military said its analysis showed that the rocket was launched from an area north of the village of Chebaa in southern Lebanon.
Majdal Shams had not been among border communities ordered to evacuate as tensions rose, Israel's military said, without saying why.
Hamas' attack on Oct. 7 killed some 1,200 people and took 250 others hostage.

The Israeli military’s chief spokesman, Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari, called it the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the Hamas attack on October 7 that sparked the war in Gaza.
The strike followed earlier cross-border violence on Saturday, when Hezbollah said three of its fighters were killed, without specifying where.
Ha’il Mahmoud, a resident of Majdal Shams, told Channel 12 that children were playing football when the rocket hit the field.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since October 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.
Since early October, Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed more than 450 people, mostly Hezbollah members, but also around 90 civilians and non-combatants.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warned that Hezbollah “will pay a heavy price for this attack, one that it has not paid so far,” his office said after a rocket strike on a football field killed at least 11 children and teenagers.
It is the deadliest strike on an Israeli target along the country’s northern border since the fighting between Israel and Hezbollah erupted, and risked unleashing a broader regional war.
The strike followed earlier cross-border violence on Saturday, when Hezbollah said three of its fighters were killed, without specifying where.
Ha’il Mahmoud, a resident of Majdal Shams, told Channel 12 that children were playing football when the rocket hit the field.
Since early October, Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed more than 450 people, mostly Hezbollah members, but also around 90 civilians and non-combatants.

Strike on Israeli Golan Heights kills 11 and threatens to spark a wider war.
Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
Israel’s military said its air force targeted a Hezbollah arms depot in the border village of Kfar Kila, adding that militants were inside at the time.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since Oct. 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.
Majdal Shams had not been among border communities ordered to evacuate as tensions rose, Israel’s military said, without saying why.

Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
“There is no doubt that Hezbollah has crossed all the red lines here, and the response will reflect that,” Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz told Israeli Channel 12.
Israel’s military said its air force targeted a Hezbollah arms depot on the border village of Kfar Kila, adding that militants were inside at the time.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since Oct. 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.

Netanyahu says Hezbollah will pay ‘heavy price’ after deadly Golan Heights strike that group deniesTEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — A rocket strike Saturday at a soccer field killed at least 11 children and teens, Israeli authorities said, in the deadliest strike on an Israeli target along the country's northern border since the fighting between Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah began.
Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warned that Hezbollah “will pay a heavy price for this attack, one that it has not paid so far."
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since Oct. 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.
Since early October, Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed more than 450 people, mostly Hezbollah members, but also around 90 civilians and non-combatants.

Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
“There is no doubt that Hezbollah has crossed all the red lines here, and the response will reflect that,” Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz told Israeli Channel 12.

Israel says all 10 killed in attack on town in Israeli-controlled Golan Heights were 20 and underBy Tia Goldenberg And Bassem Mroue, The Associated Press on July 27, 2024.
(AP Photo)TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) – The Israeli military says all 10 people killed in a rocket attack on town in Israeli-controlled Golan Heights were aged 10 to 20.
TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) – A rocket attack Saturday on a soccer field in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights killed at least 10 people and wounded several others, including children, hours after an Israeli airstrike on south Lebanon killed three members of the militant Hezbollah group.
Hezbollah said it struck a military base in the Golan Heights in retaliation for Israeli attacks on a village in Lebanon.
Israel captured the Golan Heights from Syria during the 1967 Mideast war and later annexed them in 1981.

TEL AVIV, Israel — A rocket attack Saturday on a soccer field in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights killed at least 10 people and wounded several others, including children, hours after an Israeli airstrike on south Lebanon killed three members of the militant Hezbollah group.
Hezbollah said it struck a military base in the Golan Heights in retaliation for Israeli attacks on a village in Lebanon.
The Israeli military said one projectile was identified crossing from Lebanon toward the area, adding it was cooperating with the MDA to evacuate the wounded.
Hezbollah said in a statement that its militants firing Katyusha rockets at an Israeli army post in the Golan Heights was in response to Israeli airstrikes on villages in south Lebanon.
Israel captured the Golan Heights from Syria during the 1967 Mideast war and later annexed them in 1981.

TEL AVIV — A rocket attack Saturday on a soccer field in the Golan Heights killed at least 10 people and wounded several others, including children, Israel said, hours after an Israeli airstrike on south Lebanon killed three members of the militant Hezbollah group.
Hezbollah said it struck a military base in the Golan Heights in retaliation for Israeli attacks on a village in Lebanon.
“These were kids at a soccer field,” head of the local council Beni Ben Muvchar told Israeli Channel 12.
Israel and Hezbollah have traded near daily fire since the war in Gaza started after Hamas’ surprise attack on October7 killed some 1,200 people and took 250 others hostage.
Since early October, Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed more than 450 people, mostly Hezbollah members, but also around 90 civilians and non-combatants.

TEL AVIV, Israel — A rocket attack Saturday on a soccer field in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights killed at least 10 people and wounded several others, including children, hours after an Israeli airstrike on south Lebanon killed three members of the militant Hezbollah group.
Hezbollah said it struck a military base in the Golan Heights in retaliation for Israeli attacks on a village in Lebanon.
The Israeli military said one projectile was identified crossing from Lebanon toward the area, adding it was cooperating with the MDA to evacuate the wounded.
Hezbollah said in a statement that its militants firing Katyusha rockets at an Israeli army post in the Golan Heights was in response to Israeli airstrikes on villages in south Lebanon.
Israel captured the Golan Heights from Syria during the 1967 Mideast war and later annexed them in 1981.

Israel blamed the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
He called it the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the Hamas attack on Oct. 7 that sparked the war in Gaza.
Hezbollah chief spokesman Mohammed Afif told The Associated Press that the group “categorically denies carrying out an attack on Majdal Shams.” It is unusual for Hezbollah to deny an attack.
Ha’il Mahmoud, a resident of Majdal Shams, told Channel 12 that children were playing soccer when the rocket hit the field.
Lebanon's government in a statement, without mentioning Majdal Shams, urged “immediate cessation of hostilities on all fronts” and condemned all attacks on civilians.

A rocket strike Saturday on a soccer field killed at least 11 children and teens, Israeli authorities said, in the deadliest strike on an Israeli target along the country's northern border since the fighting between Israel and Hezbollah erupted.
Israel blamed the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
He called it the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the Hamas attack on Oct. 7 that sparked the war in Gaza.
Ha’il Mahmoud, a resident of Majdal Shams, told Channel 12 that children were playing soccer when the rocket hit the field.
Lebanon's government in a statement, without mentioning Majdal Shams, urged “immediate cessation of hostilities on all fronts” and condemned all attacks on civilians.

The Israeli military’s chief spokesman, Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari, called it the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the Hamas attack on October 7 that sparked the war in Gaza.
The strike followed earlier cross-border violence on Saturday, when Hezbollah said three of its fighters were killed, without specifying where.
Ha’il Mahmoud, a resident of Majdal Shams, told Channel 12 that children were playing football when the rocket hit the field.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since October 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.
Since early October, Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed more than 450 people, mostly Hezbollah members, but also around 90 civilians and non-combatants.

Strike on Israeli Golan Heights kills 11 and threatens to spark a wider war.
Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
The Israeli military's chief spokesman, Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari, called it the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the Hamas attack on Oct. 7 that sparked the war in Gaza.
“There is no doubt that Hezbollah has crossed all the red lines here, and the response will reflect that,” Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz told Israeli Channel 12.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since Oct. 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.

Israel blamed Hezbollah for the strike in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, but Hezbollah rushed to deny any role.
Israeli police officers and firefighters work at the site of a rocket attack in Majdal Shams, in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights.
Hezbollah chief spokesman Mohammed Afif told The Associated Press that the group "categorically denies carrying out an attack on Majdal Shams."
Destroyed children's bicycles at the site of a rocket attack in the Druze town of Majdal Shams, in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights.
Residents rush to help injured children moments after a rocket attack hit a soccer field.

Hezbollah had earlier announced several rocket attacks targeting Israeli military positions.
Hezbollah had earlier announced firing a Falaq-1 missile on Saturday, saying it had targeted an Israeli military headquarters.
Hamas has also carried out rocket attacks on Israel from Lebanon, as has the Lebanese Sunni group, the Jama'a Islamiya.
The Israeli military said its aircraft had targeted a military structure belonging to Hezbollah, after identifying a militant cell entering the building.
Hezbollah claimed at least four attacks, including with Katyusha rockets, in retaliation for the Kfarkila attacks.

"We are in difficult moments, a heavy tragedy, a dark day has come to Majdal Shams," said Dolan Abu Saleh, head of the Majdal Shams local council in comments broadcast on Israeli television.
An Israeli military spokesperson had earlier told reporters that forensics showed the rocket was an Iranian-made Falaq-1.
Hezbollah had announced firing a Falaq-1 missile on Saturday, saying it had aimed at an Israeli military headquarters.
Hamas has also carried out rocket attacks on Israel from Lebanon, as has the Lebanese Sunni group, the Jama'a Islamiya.
(Reporting by Avi Ohayon and Ammar Awad in Majdal Shams, Ari Rabinovitch in Jerusalem and Maya Gebeily in Beirut, Editing by William Maclean)

Irish premier Simon Harris has condemned an Israeli airstrike attack on a school building in which dozens were killed and injured as “inhumane and despicable”.
At least 30 people sheltering at a girls’ school in Deir Al-Balah were taken to hospital and pronounced dead, after a strike that Israel’s military said targeted Hamas militants’ operations.
In a statement, Taoiseach Simon Harris condemned the attack as “a further demonstration of brutal, unconscionable violence”.
The war began with an assault by Hamas militants on southern Israel on October 7 that killed 1,200 people, most of them civilians, and took about 250 hostages.
About 115 are still in Gaza, about a third of them believed to be dead, according to Israeli authorities.

Taoiseach Simon Harris described an Israeli attack on a school building as ‘inhuman and despicable’ (Brian Lawless/PA)Irish premier Simon Harris has condemned an Israeli airstrike attack on a school building in which dozens were killed and injured as “inhumane and despicable”.
In a statement, Taoiseach Simon Harris condemned the attack as “a further demonstration of brutal, unconscionable violence”.
“I again call for an immediate ceasefire, the release of all hostages and unimpeded access for aid into Gaza.
“The bloodshed and suffering need to end.”Israel’s military offensive in Gaza has killed more than 39,100 Palestinians, according to the territory’s health ministry.
About 115 are still in Gaza, about a third of them believed to be dead, according to Israeli authorities.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warned that Hezbollah “will pay a heavy price for this attack, one that it has not paid so far,” his office said after a rocket strike on a football field killed at least 11 children and teenagers.
The Israeli military’s chief spokesman, Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari, called it the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the Hamas attack on October 7 that sparked the war in Gaza.
The strike followed earlier cross-border violence on Saturday, when Hezbollah said three of its fighters were killed, without specifying where.

The strike followed earlier cross-border violence on Saturday, when Hezbollah said three of its fighters were killed, without specifying where.
Ha’il Mahmoud, a resident of Majdal Shams, told Channel 12 that children were playing football when the rocket hit the field.
Israel and Hezbollah have been trading fire since October 8, a day after Hamas militants stormed into southern Israel.

3266981e-a1c0-4889-a83b-89efe0c5c839.location: The location specified in the text is Gaza.

messages.message:
GAZA – At least 30 people have been killed and over 100 injured in an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, according to the Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza.
The Israeli military it had launched the strike in order to destroy a Hamas command and control center inside the compound.
More than 4,000 displaced people were housed in the school, the Palestinian Civil Defense said.
Fighting has been ongoing on Gaza for months, and the renewed offensive shows Israel’s challenges in achieving its goal of eliminating Hamas.
The United Nations estimated that about 150,000 people fled Khan Younis on Monday alone, intensifying pressure on meager supplies of food and water, and places to seek shelter.

CNN —At least 30 people have been killed and over 100 injured in an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, where thousands were sheltering, Palestinian officials said.
The Israeli military said it had launched the strike in order to destroy a Hamas command and control center inside the compound.
The United Nations estimated that about 150,000 people fled Khan Younis on Monday alone, intensifying pressure on meager supplies of food and water, and places to seek shelter.
Scenes filmed by CNN in Khan Younis show people fleeing by car, motorbike, and donkey cart with all of their belongings.
Israel launched its military offensive in Gaza on October 7 after Hamas attacked southern Israel.

ISRAEL’S EMERGENCY MEDICAL service has said at least 10 people were killed by rocket strikes in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights in Syria today, with the Israeli military blaming the attack on Lebanese militant group Hezbollah, who have denied responsibility.
The rocket fire came after an Israeli strike killed four Hezbollah fighters in south Lebanon prompting the Iran-backed militant group to announce a flurry of retaliatory rocket attacks against the Golan and northern Israel.
Magen David Adom reported 10 dead and 19 wounded after the rocket hit on the town of Majdal Shams.
“The Hezbollah terrorist organization is behind the rocket launch at a soccer field in Majdal Shams,” the Israeli army said in a statement.
The rocket fire came after a Lebanese security source said an Israeli strike killed four Hezbollah fighters in the southern village of Kfar Kila.

Majdal Shams: Israel's emergency medical service said at least 10 people were killed in the annexed Golan Heights on Saturday by a barrage of rockets fired from Lebanon.
The 10 were killed when a rocket hit a football pitch in the Arab town of Majdal Shams, Magen David Adom said.
The rocket fire came after an Israeli strike killed four Hezbollah fighters in south Lebanon prompting the militant group to announce a flurry of retaliatory rocket attacks against the Golan and northern Israel.
Magen David Adom reported 10 dead and 19 wounded after the rocket hit on the town of Majdal Shams.
The police and the army said rockets had struck multiple locations in the Golan, including Majdal Shams.

A rocket fired from Lebanon hit a football pitch in an Arab town in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights Saturday, killing 11 youngsters in what the army described as the “deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since October 7”.
The army said Lebanese militant group Hezbollah fired the deadly rocket that killed the youngsters aged between 10 and 20 years when they were hit on the pitch in the town of Majdal Shams.
The rocket fire came after an Israeli strike killed four Hezbollah fighters in south Lebanon prompting the Iran-backed militant group to announce a flurry of retaliatory rocket attacks against the Golan and northern Israel.
Military spokesman Daniel Hagari said on X that 11 youngsters were killed in the attack, while the emergency service Magen David Adom said 19 others were wounded when the rocket hit Majdal Shams.
The police and the army said the rocket fired at Majdal Shams was part of a barrage of rockets fired from Lebanon which struck multiple locations in the Golan.

(MENAFN- IANS) Srinagar, July 27 (IANS) Three were on Saturday in a fierce gun battle on the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's (J&K) Kupwara District.
Official sources said that three soldiers were injured when firing exchanges took place near Kumkarib post on the LoC in Trehgam sector of Kupwara District on Saturday.
“Some movement was noticed by the soldiers on the LoC after which firing exchanges started between the terrorists and the armymen.
On July 18, two terrorists were killed when the Army foiled an infiltration bid on the LoC in Keran sector of Kupwara District.
It is yet to be ascertained whether Saturday's firing exchanges were due to an infiltration bid or some other attempt by terrorists operating from across the LoC.

Srinagar: Three Army soldiers were injured on Saturday in a fierce gun battle on the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir’s (J&K) Kupwara District.
Official sources said that three soldiers were injured when firing exchanges took place near Kumkarib post on the LoC in Trehgam sector of Kupwara District on Saturday.
“Some terrorist movement was noticed by the soldiers on the LoC after which firing exchanges started between the terrorists and the armymen.
Terrorists aided by Pakistan Army have been making fresh infiltration attempts in J&K in recent days.
On July 18, two terrorists were killed when the Army foiled an infiltration bid on the LoC in Keran sector of Kupwara District.

EU foreign affairs chief Josep Borrell on Saturday (27 July) called for a “political solution” to end the “madness” in Gaza after the Hamas-run territory’s health ministry said an Israeli strike on a school had killed 30 people.
The Hamas-run government media office said 15 children and eight women were among those killed in the strike in the central town of Deir Al-Balah.
More than 100 people were wounded, the media office and the Gaza health ministry said.
Only a political solution will end this madness,” Borrell said in a post on X, formerly Twitter.
Hezbollah denied any responsibility for the strike, the deadliest in Israel or Israeli-annexed territory since the start of the conflict in Gaza.

CAIRO: At least 30 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli airstrike on a school housing displaced people in Gaza on Saturday, Palestinian health officials said.
The Hamas-run government media office said 15 children and eight women were among those killed in the strike in the central town of Deir Al-Balah.
Separately, nine people were killed in a rocket attack on a football ground in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights on Saturday.
Now her daughter had been wounded in the strike and taken to hospital, she said.
The people sheltering in Khadija school are all wounded people, they are innocent and this should not happen to them,” she said.

Israeli authorities say 12 people, including children, have been killed by a rocket strike on a soccer pitch in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.
The group had earlier announced several rocket attacks targeting Israeli military positions in other locations from Lebanon.
Israel's Foreign Minister Israel Katz said Israel was approaching an all-out war against Hezbollah and Lebanon, Axios reported.
"The Hezbollah attack today crossed all red lines, and the response will be accordingly.
Axios reports the US government is also concerned the attack could lead to an all-out war between Hezbollah and Israel.

"The Hezbollah attack today crossed all red lines, and the response will be accordingly.
We are approaching the moment of an all-out war against Hezbollah and Lebanon," Katz told Axios.
Hezbollah had earlier announced several rocket attacks targeting Israeli military positions.
The Israeli military said its aircraft had targeted a military structure belonging to Hezbollah, after identifying a militant cell entering the building.

Cabinet minister Steve Reed reiterated calls for a ceasefire and the release of hostages after strikes killed dozens in Gaza and the Israeli-occupied Golan HeightsA Cabinet minister said it was “heartbreaking” to see tensions deepening in the Middle East after strikes killed dozens in Gaza and the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights over the weekend.
Environment Secretary Steve Reed reiterated calls for an immediate ceasefire as well as for the release of hostages held by Hamas.
At least 30 people, including seven children, were killed by an Israeli airstrike in central Gaza, according to Palestinian health officials.
The strike in Golan Heights has raised fears of a broader regional war between Israel and Hezbollah.
Since early October, Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed more than 500 people, mostly Hezbollah members, but also around 90 civilians.

The strike raised fears of a broader regional war between Israel and Hezbollah, which in a rare move denied it was responsible for the attack.
Overnight, the Israeli military said it struck a number of targets inside Lebanon, though their intensity was similar to months of cross-border fighting between Israel and the Iranian-backed Hezbollah.
Twelve people between ages 10 and 20 were killed, and 20 were wounded, according to the Israeli military.
There are about 140,000 Druze in Israel, 25,000 in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, according to Yusri Hazran of the Hebrew University.

The strike raised fears of a broader regional war between Israel and Hezbollah, which denied a role in the attack.

Twelve young people between the ages of 10 and 20 were killed, and 20 were wounded, according to the Israeli military.

An officer and soldier in the Armored Corps from the 82nd Battalion were seriously wounded earlier on Sunday while in combat in the southern Gaza Strip, the IDF stated on Sunday.
The soldiers were evacuated for medical treatment, and their families were notified.

IDF Spokesperson:

An officer and a soldier from the 82nd Battalion, 'Saar Megolan' Brigade (7), were seriously injured earlier today (Sun), in a battle in the southern Gaza Strip.

The fighters were evacuated for medical treatment, their families were informed.

Armed terrorists from the military wing of the Islamic Jihad participate in the funeral of two terrorists from the Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades who were killed by the IDF yesterday in the Balata refugee camp.
I will mention that the funeral of the two began as a military funeral on behalf of the PA's security apparatus 👆👆

Among the bearers of the stretcher with the bodies of the terrorists is Ghassan Daghlas, the governor of Nablus on behalf of the Palestinian Authority and a senior member of Fatah (circled in yellow).

After the military funeral held by the PA's security forces for the terrorist Luay Mashe, who was killed yesterday in an Israeli airstrike in the Balata refugee camp, his friends wrap him in the flag of the military wing of the Islamic Jihad.

As you can see, one thing is related to the other... an operative of Fatah's al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades receives a military funeral of the Palestinian Authority and then is wrapped in a flag of the Islamic Jihad....
The United Nations: 29 thousand Gazans were in the area that the IDF spokesperson instructed to evacuate today to the center of the Gaza Strip.
The Palestinians report that IDF soldiers are now setting fire to houses in the north of the Nuseirat refugee camp in the center of the Gaza Strip.
